DOC.brief_title: Antithymocyte Globulin Cyclosporine Treating Low Risk Patients With Myelodysplastic Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Patients treat : Antithymocyte globulin ( Timoglobulin SangStat ) - 2,5 mg/kg/day IV 8 hour day 1-4 - Total dose : 10 mg/kg - Calculated dose adjust ideal weight - Especial consideration : Paracetamol 1 gr ( oral IV ) Dexclorfeniramine 5 mg IV Methylprednisolone 1 mg/kg IV 30 minute Timoglobulin repeat necessary 4 hour - Platelet transfusion platelet count < 50 x 109/L Cyclosporine ( Sandimmun Neoral ) -2,5 mg/kg/12 h 3 month
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis low intermediate risk myelodysplastic syndrome ( MDS ) ( high risk patient eligible intensive chemotherapy bone marrow transplantation ) , exclude chronic myelomonocytic leukemia At less one two follow condition : Transfusion dependence : 1 ) Packed red blood cell transfusion great 2 time ; 2 ) Untransfused hemoglobin level great 10 g/dL ; 3 ) Platelet transfusion great 1 time Infection grade III IV secondary neutropenia ECOG < = 2 Chronic myelomonocytic leukemia Creatinine great 2 mg/dl Bilirubin great 2.5 mg/dl History heart failure History allergy rabbit protein
